products.name: Krishna Subdues the Serpent King Kaliya

Blue.description: Pale blue with flaked paint; Raman confirmed indigo
Dark blue; XRF is similar to paper; area is transparent in IR; indigo confirmed with Raman

Pink.description: XRF is similar to white areas; Raman showed no identifiable peaks; this indicates white clay and organic red; in South Asian material, organic red is likely to be madder or lac dye.

Red.description: Raman confirmed vermilion/cinnabar; Arsenic from underlying green pigment

Black.description: Transparent in IR; indigo confirmed with Raman; orpiment is from adjacent areas

Brown.description: Brown figures and birds are somewhat opaque in IR, consistent with a mixture of iron ochre and orpiment; Raman confirmed only orpiment.

Green.description: Transparent in IR, Raman confirmed orpiment and indigo
Transparent in IR, Raman confirmed indigo and orpiment

White.description: Raman showed no identifiable peaks; Some arsenic present in the spectra likely from underlying background.

Yellow.description: Variable levels of elements; all low/trace

Metallic.description: Further analysis should be done on this folio

Red.description:
Red_2. Reddish orange
Raman needs to be done on this folio

Purple.description: Organic colorant, silver from grey stripes

Green.description: Green_4. Non fluorescent, no elements listed
Green_3. UV fluorescent, no elements listed

products.name: Krishna Receives Homage from a Prince (Analysis 1)

Red.description: Violet-red; appears to have some pink purple under other colors but final background layers are definitely later; In South Asian material, organic red is likely to be madder or lac dye.

Yellow.description: Mustard-yellow; small gypsum; mustard yellow has yellow, some green, not clear what this pigment is  test for gamboge?

Green.description: Dark green outlines to leaves have some florescence

products.name: Krishna Receives Homage from a Prince (Analysis 2)

White.description: Calcium  whites are listed as calcite, although some were aragonite in FTIR

Yellow.description: FTIR confirmed Indian yellow and aragonite
No XRF or Raman peaks; FTIR indicates Indian yellow
Raman confirmed ultramarine, CaCO3, indigo, and orpiment

Metallic.description: Calcium is likely from underlying white. Ca is likely from underlying white

Blue.description: Opaque in IRR; Raman confirmed ultramarine plus small calcium carbonate peak

products.name: Young Lord Krishna and His Friends Steal His Mother's Butter

Pink.description: Bright green fluorescene; likely modern inpainting of zinc white

Brown.description: Mostly transparent in IRR indication only small amounts or iron or copper based pigments

White.description:
needs further analysis

Pt 13 has less Ca because very little pigment remains

Grey.description:
needs further analysis

Slightly opaque in IRR thus may contain carbon black

Black.description: Opaque in IRR thus contains carbon black
